channel.title: Mountain Time Zone on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Mountain Time Zone on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: US-26 East - Malheur County / Mountain Time
item.description: Entering Malheur County / Mountain Time Zone on US-26 east. Most of Oregon is in Pacific Time, except for the northern half of Malheur County and some communities in Hells Canyon.

item.title: US-20 East - Malheur County/Mountain Time Zone
item.description: Entering Malheur County and Mountain Time Zone on US-20 East. The northern portion of Malheur County is the only area in Oregon that follows Mountain Time. From my travels in Oregon, this is the only blue time zone sign in the state. The rest are the standard green color.

item.title: RM-652 - Mountain Time Zone
item.description: Entering Mountain Time Zone on RM-652 west.

item.title: OR-78 East - Mountain Time Zone
item.description: Entering Mountain Time Zone on OR-78 east.

item.title: US-93 North - Entering Jackpot and Mountain Time
item.description: Entering Mountain Time Zone and Jackpot on US-93 north. Most of Nevada is on Pacific Time, except for a few of the border towns, bordering states in Mountain Time. Jackpot is on the border with Idaho.

item.title: I-80 East - Entering Mountain Time Zone
item.description: Entering Mountain Time Zone on I-80 east, just before the Nevada-Utah state line.

item.title: US-30 East - Mountain Time Zone
item.description: Mountain Time - Set Your Watch Ahead One Hour, on US-30 east.

item.title: MT-200 East - Mountain Standard Time Zone
item.description: Mountain Time Zone at ID-MT Border on MT-200 East
